thread.title: The Instagrammers with the best followers to following ratio
thread.title_full: The Instagrammers with the best followers to following ratio

title: The Instagrammers with the best followers to following ratio
text:
The Instagrammers with the best followers to following ratio The Instagrammers with the best followers to following ratio 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
For some people, there’s no point having a ton of followers if you follow all of them back. What are you, a peasant? Pfft. 
Luckily, the kind of #Follow4Follow craze that took off on Twitter during its early days never really reached Instagram – it was always a sham anyway, the people would unfollow you as soon as you followed them back. Gotta keep that ratio healthy. 
But if you’re famous, there are no expectations on you to follow your fans back on social media. Sure, it looks good if you do, but these people look up to you as a God anyway. You may as well thrive on the power, right? Here are a few people who are just too good to follow people back. Their feeds may be incredibly dull, but their follower to following ratio is 100 emoji. 1. Beyonce 
They don’t call her Queen B for nothing. Beyonce is followed by over 47 million people at the time of writing – about 13 million more people than there are in Canada. How many does she follow? Zero. Zilch. Not even Jay-Z (who, to be fair, doesn’t follow her either). 2. Justin Timberlake 
Is JT even relevant enough right now to be pulling these kinds of stunts? BRING. OUT. SOME. MUSIC. At least 15.7 million people want to hear it – or watch the video – make them happy! Justin is another who doesn’t follow anyone. Promoted stories 3. Scott Disick 
Timberlake, we’re so sorry we ever questioned your relevance. At least you actually have a talent. What even is a TV personality? Do you have a personality away from TV? 
Clearly, though, 11 million people care enough to follow Scott on Instagram, and he cares about no one in return. 4. Nails videos 
We saw this and thought, “really?”, nails videos has over seven million Instagram followers? But then we looked on their page. They’re magic. They need not follow anyone. Magic. 5. Chanel 
Almost seven million followers for Chanel – so not quite as popular as magic nails up there – but still pretty impressive. They’re also too prestige to follow anyone, but the fact that they don’t probably helps their image. 
Also, glow-up sandals? Need. 6. Nailsartvidss 
Almost eight million followers for these nail art people but, finally, we have someone who follows someone back! Also, wow. Nails are popular. 7. Iggy Azalea 
Iggy Azalea has almost eight million followers too, and also follows one person. Has anyone heard from Iggy lately? She appears to have lost anything even closely resembling relevance, not that we’re particularly bothered by this. 8. Liam Payne 
Who’d have thought Liam Payne would be the most popular member of One Direction on Instagram? Almost seven million followers, and following one person. 
Annoyed Animated GIF 9. Zlatan Ibrahimovic 
Omg, we’ve done it. We’ve found a list on which Zlatan is not the most self-involved person. The Sweden captain and all-round great guy has over eight million followers, and follows three in return! What a man. 10. Louis Vuitton 
We’re sure LV aren’t used to coming at the bottom of any list, but at least here it’s because they’re nice (sort of). Seven million followers and they’re following four. Go Louis. Share article 
The research was conducted by My Voucher Codes . Promoted Stories
